intro: Stoebe burchellii, commonly known as Burchell's sand everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, adapted to withstand arid conditions. Stoebe burchellii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
